name: horn
content:
horn noun
(ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 [ C ] a hard, pointed, often curved part that grows from the head of some animals: The bull lowered its horns and charged straight at him. The male deer grows large branching horns called antlers. Compare
tusk
Daniel Hernanz Ramos/Moment/GettyImages
[ U ] the hard substance from which the hard part on the head of some animals is made: The handle of the knife was made of horn, perhaps elk or deer. Many traditional medicines call for ivory or rhino horn.
[ C ] a part on an animal's head that sticks out in a similar way to a horn: The snail pulls in its horns. The bird's brow plumes are twice the size of its body, forming willowy horns.
More examplesFewer examplesGargoyles are often depicted with demonic features: horns, a tail, and talons.Ankylosaurus had an armoured body with a club-like tail, and spiky horns over its entire body.Rhino numbers have declined drastically as a result of being hunted for their horn.

horn noun
(VEHICLE)
B2 [ C ] a device on a vehicle that is used to make a loud noise as a warning or signal to other people: blow/sound/honk the horn The driver blew/sounded (informal honked) her horn. See also
foghorn
